sentences.sentence: The woman led the children far into the wood, where they had never been before in all their lives.
And again they made a large fire, and the mother said,

“Sit still( 不动的 ) there, you children, and when you are tired you can go to sleep. We are going into the forest to cut wood. In the evening, when we are ready to go home, we will come and fetch( 接 ) you.”
So when noon came Grethel shared her bread with Hansel, who had dropped all his bread in small crumbs( 碎屑 ) along the road.
Then night came, they went to sleep, and no one came for the poor children.
When they awoke in the middle of the night, Hansel comforted his little sister, and said,
“Wait a little, Grethel, until the moon gets up. Then we shall be able to see the way home by the crumbs of bread that I have scattered( 撒 ) along it.”
So when the moon rose they got up, but they could find no crumbs of bread, for the birds of the woods and of the fields had come and eaten them all.
Hansel thought they might find the way home anyway, but they could not.
They went on all that night, and the next day from the morning until the evening, but they could not find the way out of the wood.
They were very hungry, for they had nothing to eat but a few berries( 浆果 ) they found.

And when they were so tired that they could no longer walk, they lay down under a tree and fell asleep( 睡着了 ) 
.
It was now the third morning since they had left their father’s house.
They were always trying to get back to it, but instead of that they only found themselves farther in the wood, and if help had not soon come they would have starved( 饿死 ).
About noon they saw a pretty bird as white as snow sitting in a tree, and singing so sweetly that they stopped to listen.
And when he had finished singing, the bird spread his wings and flew in front of them, as if to show them the way.
They followed after him until they came to a little house.
The bird landed on the roof( 房顶 ), and when they came nearer they saw that the house was built of gingerbread( 姜饼 ).
It was roofed( 盖屋顶 ) with cakes, and the windows were of transparent( 透明的 ) sugar.
“We will have some of this,” said Hansel, “and make a fine meal. I will eat a piece of the roof, Grethel, and you can have some of the window—that will taste sweet.”
So Hansel reached up and broke off a bit of the roof, just to see how it tasted.
Grethel went to a window and started to eat it. Then they heard a thin voice call out from inside,
“Nibble( 啃 ), nibble, like a mouse,
Who’s been nibbling at my house?”
And the children answered, “Never mind, it is the wind.”
And they went on eating peacefully.
Hansel, who found that the roof tasted very nice, took down a great piece of it.
Grethel pulled out a large round window-pane, and sat down and began eating it.
Then the door opened, and an old woman came out, leaning( 倚靠 ) upon a crutch( 拐杖 ).
Hansel and Grethel felt very frightened( 害怕的 ), and dropped what they had in their hands.
The old woman, however, said,
“You poor lost children, how did you get here? You must come inside and stay with me, and I will take care of( 照顾 ) you.”
So she took them each by the hand, and led them into her little house.
And there they found a good meal laid out, of milk and pancakes, with sugar, apples, and nuts( 坚果 ).
After that she showed them two little white beds, and Hansel and Grethel lay down on them, and thought they were in Heaven( 天堂 ).
The old woman, although she seemed to be so kind, was a wicked( 恶毒的 ) witch( 女巫 ).
She lay in wait for the children, and had built the little house on purpose( 故意地 ) to entice( 引诱 ) them.
When they were once inside she would kill them, cook them, and eat them, and then it was a happy day for her.
The witch’s eyes were red, and she could not see very far, but she had an excellent sense of smell( 嗅觉 ), as animals do, and knew very well when humans were near.
When she knew that Hansel and Grethel were coming, she laughed cruelly( 残酷地 ), and said in triumph( 洋洋得意地 ):
“I have them, and they shall not escape( 逃过...的注意 ) me!”
Early in the morning, before the children were awake, she got up to look at them, and as they lay sleeping so peacefully with their round pink cheeks( 脸颊 ), she said to herself,
“What a fine feast( 大餐 ) I shall have!”
Then she took hold of Hansel by the hand, and led him into a little stable( 马厩 ), and locked him up there;
and though he called and screamed( 叫喊 ), there was no one to hear him.
Then she went back to Grethel and shook her, crying( 大声说 ),
“Get up, you lazy girl! Fetch( 去拿来 ) water, and cook something nice for your brother.
He is outside in the stable, and must be fattened up. And when he is fat enough, I will eat him.”
Grethel began to cry bitterly( 伤心地 ), but it was of no use.
She had to do as the wicked witch told her.

article_info.previous: 恶毒的继母把孩子们带到森林，企图丢弃他们。聪明的Hansel凭着丢在路上的鹅卵石，在月光的照耀下带着妹妹找到了回家的路。不久，继母再次故伎重施，可怜的兄妹俩还能像上次一样幸运吗？
article_info.share_words: So when noon came Grethel shared her bread with Hansel, who had dropped all his bread in small crumbs along the road.

question.cn: 为什么他们找不到面包屑了？
question.en: Why couldn’t they find the crumbs of bread?

options.cn: 因为他们的继母把面包屑打扫干净了。
options.en: Because their step-mother had cleaned them.

options.cn: 因为鸟儿们把面包屑都吃掉了。
options.en: Because the birds had eaten them all.

analysis: 文中提到：“So when the moon rose they got up, but they could find no crumbs of bread, for the birds of the woods and of the fields had come and eaten them all.”因此答案选B。
文中提到：“The old woman, although she seemed to be so kind, was a wicked witch.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 为什么邪恶的女巫要建这所小房子？
question.en: Why did the wicked witch build the little house?

options.cn: 引诱孩子们进来，然后吃掉他们。
options.en: To entice children in and eat them.

options.cn: 给饥饿的孩子提供食物。
options.en: To provide hungry children with food.
To attract children to live in the house.

analysis: 文中提到：“She lay in wait for the children, and had built the little house on purpose to entice them. When they were once inside she would kill them, cook them, and eat them, and then it was a happy day for her.”因此答案选A。
